column4: Does Wubi install ubuntu on its own partition?  What's the difference between using Wubi and installing from CD?
The reason being that I have been unsuccessful in trying to get my computer to boot from USB key, and don't have a cd-rom drive and was looking to use Wubi to install Ubuntu
wubi is a file in windows.
yes, do you know the out of the bios key prompt to choose the boot?
you tr f12 at powering on?
how are you loading the usb?
tap the shift key at powering on at the gui hit f6 then nomodeset for a low graphic boot sounds like a graphic card problem.
hard to say but unplug it if needed try the f6 plugged and unplugged.
start tapping as you turn it on it gets you to a early gui.
with unetbootin fat
on the web it says a nividia card so te problem is the graphic driver the low graphic should work.
if the usb is booting sounds like it is.
can you try the usb on another conputer to confirm it is good?
usb did not boot on another computer, gave the same blinking cursor for about 2 minutes
sounds like the usb needs reloading reformat the usb and use a fat32, unetbootin run in admin in ubuntu i forget for windows.
you have it what config right now?
I have it in fat32
you might try another loader pendrivelinux has several one for running ubuntu called multisystem, and I think the other called yum for windows.

here is the yum for windows use, yeah it may be a problem with unetbootin, never happened to e but it does happen. https://encrypted.google.com/url?url=http://www.pendrivelinux.com/yumi-multiboot-usb-creator/&rct=j&sa=U&ei=LoC3TvS9L8qPiAKMubRm&ved=0CBwQFjAB&q=+pendrivelinux+usb+loader&usg=AFQjCNG-iracoPBlmk_IfBJCXaKZy9dabg
application in windows
geek7:  I did the HP tool then used YUMI, WoRKS!!! thank you guys very much for the help
